p: In addition to pandemic COVID-19 virus infections, influenza virus remains a major threat to public health and causes significant morbidity and mortality worldwide from annual seasonal epidemics and periodic pandemics [ 1, 2]. According to WHO, seasonal influenza affects 5â€“10% of the global population annually and results in 3-5 million hospitalizations and about half a million deaths per year. Pandemic influenza A virus (IAV) represents an even greater concern. Due to the rapid mutation rate of human IAVs, antigenically novel viruses are emerging periodically, which are difficult to predict, prevent, or treat [ 3]. Zoonotic influenza viruses of H5N1, H9N2 and recently, H7N9 and H10N8 subtypes have been identified as potentially pandemic [ 4, 5].
